notes: The High Pinion Dana 30 from XJs (non-disconnect versions) is a direct bolt-in upgrade for TJs and ZJs (which often came with Low Pinion). ZJ V8 tie rods are a massive strength upgrade for XJ/TJ steering. Ford 8.8 rear axles (Explorer) are a common swap for the weak Dana 35 rear.

partName: Toyota Land Cruiser / Lexus LX Interchange
notes: Lexus LX450 IS a Land Cruiser 80. LX470 IS a Land Cruiser 100. Most mechanical parts (axles, suspension, engine parts) are identical. Lexus versions often have hydraulic suspension (AHC) which can be swapped for standard Land Cruiser coil springs/torsion bars for reliability.

partName: Suzuki Samurai / Sidekick / Geo Tracker Mix
notes: The 1.6L engine from the Sidekick/Tracker is a popular swap into the Samurai (which has a 1.3L). Requires an adapter plate for the transmission. Sidekick power steering boxes are also a common upgrade for Samurais. Geo Trackers are mechanically identical to Suzuki Sidekicks.

partName: Land Rover Discovery / Defender / Range Rover Classic
notes: These three share the same chassis architecture, axles, and suspension design. You can swap differentials (Rover type), suspension springs, and even engines (200Tdi/300Tdi/V8) between them with relative ease. Discovery 1 axles are a cheap source of disc brakes for older Series Land Rovers (with major mods).

The Ford 8.8 rear axle from 95-01 Explorers is legendary. It has 31-spline axles, disc brakes, and is nearly as strong as a Dana 60. It is the go-to swap for Jeeps running 35"+ tires. Requires welding new spring perches and shock mounts.

The 'Tundra Brake Upgrade' (199mm or 231mm calipers) is a direct bolt-on for 3rd Gen 4Runners and 1st Gen Tacomas. Significantly larger calipers and rotors. 231mm calipers (13WL) require 16" wheels or larger. Massive stopping power improvement.
